formatted_address: Piazza della Repubblica, 20, 20124 Milano MI, Italy
name: The Westin Palace, Milan

plus_code.compound_code: F5HX+FM Milan, Metropolitan City of Milan, Italy

reviews.text: Great Hotel overall, delicious breakfast and nice rooms. The service was not up to 5-star standard though. We ordered food to the Hotel quite late one evening after a long day of travel and the receptionist forced us to leave our room and come down to the reception in robes to collect our food. We had both had good experiences with food delivery in other hotels and were expecting the food to be delivered to the room, especially since it was so late. Having to come down to the hotels entrance/reception to collect the food was quite honestly humiliating and just disappointing service.

We had a lovely two night stay at Westin Palace, from the check-in experience, Nicole was extremely kind and helpful even walking us to our rooms. I was initially worried about the cleanliness of the rooms due to past reviews but our room was spotless, although the washroom was a bit dated however, it was spacious and the amenities offered were plenty. The valet and bell service are also exemplary, quick and efficient!

Westin Palace will be our first choice of stay next time we are in Milan! Thank you for a great ending to our trip!

We had such a wonderful stay here! The hotel is dated but truly classic and royal, evoking a palace atmosphere. The service and the staff are outstanding. The breakfast buffet was lovely, and as elite members, we received a discounted rate, and the kids were free. Felt sad to depart.

Disappointing Experience at The Westin Palace Hotel, Milan
I recently stayed at The Westin Palace Hotel in Milan with my husband and daughter, and unfortunately, my experience was far from what I expected from a five-star establishment. As a Marriott gold member ( my husband and the reservation was under his name), I had anticipated a high standard of service and cleanliness, but I encountered numerous issues that significantly affected my stay.
Firstly, the cleanliness of the room was subpar. I found several areas that had clearly been overlooked by housekeeping, which was very disappointing. After contacting the front desk to voice my concerns, I did notice an improvement in cleaning on the day following my call. However, the subsequent days returned to the same poor standards, which was frustrating and unacceptable for a hotel of this caliber.
The breakfast experience was equally disappointing. When I decided to dine in the breakfast area, I encountered a long wait. The hostess was engrossed in conversation and failed to acknowledge my presence for over 15 minutes. I ultimately had to call her by name just to get seated. To add to my discontent, the table I was given was dirty, with breadcrumbs left from previous guests. I had to request that it be cleaned, which should never be necessary in a top-tier hotel.
Additionally, my attempts to have my luggage collected were met with frustration. I called multiple times for assistance, but no one responded. This lack of attention to guests’ needs is simply unacceptable for a five-star hotel.
Overall, the service throughout my stay was below average, and it’s clear that there is a significant gap between the hotel’s pricing and the quality of service provided. I was genuinely expecting a more luxurious experience based on the hotel’s branding, but I was left disappointed.
Given these experiences, I regret to say that I will not be returning to The Westin Palace Hotel in the future. The high prices should correspond with a higher standard of service and cleanliness. I sincerely hope that the management takes serious steps to address these issues for the sake of future guests.

Review: The Westin Palace Milan
A disappointing stay. Service lacked warmth, personality, and basic hospitality—no smiles, no sense of welcome. The food was average at best and not remotely worth the price. Room rates are unjustified given the experience delivered. Communication was poor throughout: follow-up requests ignored, twin bed setup repeatedly promised but never actioned. Most concerning, they attempted to take a double payment and could have simply released the original authorisation—unbelievable for a property of this calibre. For a hotel claiming five stars, it fails to meet even the basic metrics of a solid four-star. Will be booking elsewhere next time.  Ricardo was rude at Concierge - just not helpful whatsoever and didnt want to deal with us!!
